pageTitle: Surfacing aluminum parts - by GregD @ LumberJocks.com ~ woodworking community
textBeforeTable: Show all forums View all topics Start new topic signed in to reply. You must be Have your say... -- Greg D. Great. Thanks for the help. #8 posted 11-03-2011 02:43 PM 731 posts in 2108 days home | projects | blog GregD -- Adversity doesn't build character...................it reveals it. I use a piece of solid surface counter material and wet/dry sandpaper. I spritz the solid surface material to hold the sand paper, then spritz the sandpaper before I start lapping. I use this method to sharpen plane irons and chisels (with finer grits, of course) and have used it with coarser sandpaper to flatten 4-5 plane soles. #7 posted 11-03-2011 05:18 AM
